sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SPILANTHUS, in botany ; a genus of plants belonging to the claſs of ſyngenesia, and to the order of polygamia aqualis. The common calyx is erect; the leaflets numerous, ſub-equal, and oblong, the two exterior being longer than the rest. The compound corolla is uniform and tubular ; the florets are hermaphrodite and equal ; the proper corolla is funnel-ſhaped. The filaments are five in number, and ſhort. The antheræ cylindrical and tubular. The ſeeds are vertical, oblong, flat, and covered with chaff. The receptacle is paleaceous and conical. There are ſeven ſpecies, the urens, pſeudo-acmella, acmella, ſalivaria, atriplicifolia, inſipida, and oleracea.
